column5: Has anyone fished May opener in Northern Ontario on Kaby lake for walleye? Heading up Friday and still ice on lake but starting to break up. Ive never fished this early after ice out for Walleye before and our first Northern Ontario Tournies are always first and second week of JuneSent from my LG-H873 using Tapatalk

The incoming rivers is where I would focus my attention. I've never fished opener on Kaby, but we were there in July last year and the mouth of the Oba was decent. The Oba River and Kaby River should be good. Other spots I'd check are Five Mile Creek, Ermine Creek, Bear Creek, Noisey Creek. Fairy Creek, Stoney Creek, Beaver Bay....a lot of incoming water on that lake. There are also some fish sanctuaries, so I'd check on the regs for that info.
be careful and check the regs, a lot of the inflowing rivers/ creeks on Kaby are sanctuary until June 16th
Heres map of lake and shows where out of seasonhttps://uploads.tapatalk-cdn.com/201...bc283acbef.jpgSent from my LG-H873 using Tapatalk
